intro: Hieracium kerneri subsp. strictipilum, commonly known as the narrow-hair hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and basal rosette of leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its subspecies status reflects distinct morphological traits, particularly in its leaf and flowering structures.
